headline.main: NAZIS' KUBAN HOLD PARED BY RUSSIANS; Soviet Fliers and Guns Blast 40 Batteries and 24 Planes in Caucasus Attacks VOLKHOV FRONT FLARES UP Berlin Reports Clashes There and in the Orel Salient -- Claims Stiff Defense

lead_paragraph: LONDON, Sunday, May 2 (U.P.) -- Russian air and artillery units, supporting infantry attacks against the Axis bridgehead in the Northwest Caucasus, yesterday blasted out forty German batteries and shot down twenty-four enemy planes, the Soviet High Command reported today.
abstract: Capt D J Gause on Corregidor siege and his own escape; illus
